appendix.title: Setting command line parameters in the &FPA;
appendix.para:
xfpa To run the &FPA; depiction editor use the xfpa command.
xfpa -askForTimes -profile name -s[etup] filename -stateDir directory -t0 YYYY:JJJ:HH -v[isible] key +viewerMode
Explanation of xfpa optional arguments&colwidth2;
arg...meaning...
-askForTimes Puts up a dialog box asking which range of depiction times are to be read into the &FPA;
-profile key Start using the specified profile instead of putting up a dialog asking the user for a profile. "none" is a valid input.
-setup filename Specifies the name of the file to use as the setup file. This may be an absolute path name or relative to the default setup directories.
-stateDir directory The directory to use to store the state store file. This is only used if in viewer mode.
-t0 YYYY:JJJ:HH Specifies the time to use as T0 for the depiction sequence. YYYY = 4 digit year, JJJ = julian day of the year, HH = hour of the day
-visiblekey Bring up &FPA; with fields visible as specified by the block of data indicated by the key in the preset field visibility config file.
+viewerMode Runs the &FPA; in viewer mode. All loading, deletion, saving and editing commands are not available so that only sequence viewing is possible.
